author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A compelling story of love, ambition, and tragedy set in the roaring twenties.
quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.

author: Harper Lee
review: A poignant exploration of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.
quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopian novel that remains relevant in its warnings about surveillance and authoritarianism.

author: Jane Austen
review: A timeless romance that explores themes of social class and personal growth.
quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: An iconic portrayal of teenage angst and alienation in post-war America.
quote: Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A delightful adventure tale set in Middle-earth, perfect for readers of all ages.
quote: In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.
